name: Exampla
description: A monoclonal antibody targeting inflammatory pathways. Exampla is a fully human monoclonal antibody that selectively binds to and neutralizes interleukin-12 (IL-12) and interleukin-23 (IL-23), two key cytokines involved in inflammatory and immune responses associated with autoimmune conditions.

timeline.description: Lead antibody identified and characterized in preclinical studies.
IND-enabling studies completed with favorable safety profile.
First-in-human clinical trial initiated in healthy volunteers.
Phase 2 trials in rheumatoid arthritis and psoriasis patients showing promising efficacy.
Global Phase 3 program initiated across multiple indications.
FDA approval for rheumatoid arthritis and psoriasis.
Commercial launch in the United States.

approvals.details: Approved for moderate to severe rheumatoid arthritis in adults who have had inadequate response to conventional therapy.
Approved for moderate to severe plaque psoriasis in adults who are candidates for systemic therapy.
Approved for moderate to severe active rheumatoid arthritis in adults with inadequate response to DMARDs.
Approved for treatment of psoriasis vulgaris and psoriatic arthritis in patients who have not responded sufficiently to conventional therapies.
Approved for active psoriatic arthritis in adults.

patents.description: Composition of matter patent covering the monoclonal antibody formulation.
Method of treatment patent for autoimmune conditions.

name: CardioFix
description: A dual-action therapy for cardiovascular disease management. CardioFix combines a calcium channel blocker with a statin in a novel formulation, targeting both hypertension and hyperlipidemia simultaneously to reduce cardiovascular risk in patients with multiple risk factors.

timeline.description: Dual-action compound identified through computational drug design.
Preclinical studies demonstrated favorable pharmacokinetic profile and safety.
Phase 1 trial initiated in healthy volunteers showing good tolerability.
Phase 2 trials demonstrated significant reductions in both blood pressure and LDL-cholesterol.
Global Phase 3 program initiated in patients with hypertension and hyperlipidemia.

approvals.details: Phase 3 clinical trials in progress for the treatment of patients with both hypertension and hyperlipidemia.
Clinical trials in progress for primary and secondary prevention of atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease.

patents.description: Composition patent covering the dual-acting formulation.
Method of treatment patent for cardiovascular risk reduction.

name: OncoVax
description: Revolutionary personalized cancer vaccine that utilizes mRNA technology to target neoantigens specific to a patient's tumor. OncoVax is designed to stimulate the immune system to recognize and attack cancer cells that may remain after initial treatment, reducing the risk of recurrence in high-risk patients.

timeline.description: Technology platform established for neoantigen identification and vaccine production.
Preclinical studies showed robust T-cell responses and tumor suppression in animal models.
First-in-human study initiated in patients with resected melanoma.
Phase 2 trials initiated in multiple tumor types after promising Phase 1 results.

approvals.details: Granted Breakthrough Therapy designation for adjuvant treatment of high-risk melanoma.
Received Fast Track designation for adjuvant treatment of non-small cell lung cancer.

patents.description: Platform technology patents covering personalized neoantigen identification.
Patent covering mRNA delivery system specific for tumor neoantigens.

name: Luxient
description: Advanced targeted therapy for multiple sclerosis that modulates specific immune cell receptors to reduce inflammation and neurodegeneration in the central nervous system. Luxient represents a significant advance in MS treatment with improved selectivity and reduced side effects compared to earlier generation therapies.

timeline.description: Novel compound identified through targeted screening program.
Preclinical studies demonstrated superior BBB penetration and CNS effects.
Phase 1 trials showed favorable safety profile and target engagement.
Phase 2 trials demonstrated significant reduction in gadolinium-enhancing lesions.
Global Phase 3 program initiated in relapsing MS patients.
FDA approval for relapsing forms of MS.
Commercial launch in the United States.
Label expansion to include active secondary progressive MS.

approvals.details: Approved for treatment of patients with relapsing forms of multiple sclerosis.
Approved for treatment of adult patients with highly active relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis.
Approved for active secondary progressive multiple sclerosis with relapses.

patents.description: Composition of matter patent covering the active pharmaceutical ingredient.
Method of treatment patent for neurological disorders.

name: RespiClear
description: Next-generation inhaled therapy for severe asthma and COPD that combines a long-acting muscarinic antagonist, a long-acting beta-agonist, and an inhaled corticosteroid in a single innovative inhalation device. RespiClear provides enhanced bronchodilation and anti-inflammatory effects with once-daily dosing.

timeline.description: Triple combination concept established and formulation work initiated.
Preclinical testing demonstrated enhanced efficacy compared to dual therapies.
Phase 1 trials in healthy volunteers demonstrated good safety and tolerance.
Phase 2 studies showed significant improvements in lung function.
Global Phase 3 program initiated in asthma and COPD patients.
FDA approval for severe asthma and COPD.
Commercial launch in the United States.

approvals.details: Approved for maintenance treatment of patients with severe asthma.
Approved for maintenance treatment of patients with COPD.
Approved for maintenance treatment of severe asthma in adult patients.
Approved for symptomatic treatment of adults with COPD with FEV1 < 70% predicted.

patents.description: Composition patent covering the triple combination.
Patent covering the novel inhalation device.
